title: EarthAnchorPoint not set in Rhino 8.8
question:
Hello 
,


In Rhino 8.8 it appears that the EarthAnchorPoint command does not remember the Lat, Long, Elevation data when set and then queried.


Is this happening to anyone else?

code_blocks.code:
#! python3

import Rhino
import scriptcontext as sc

origin = Rhino.Geometry.Point3d(0.0,0.0,0.0)
north = Rhino.Geometry.Plane.WorldXY.YAxis
east = Rhino.Geometry.Plane.WorldXY.XAxis

sc.doc.EarthAnchorPoint.EarthBasepointLatitude = 47.65111166930954
sc.doc.EarthAnchorPoint.EarthBasepointLongitude = -122.35530803623594
sc.doc.EarthAnchorPoint.ModelBasepoint = origin
sc.doc.EarthAnchorPoint.ModelNorth = north
sc.doc.EarthAnchorPoint.ModelEast = east
earthpoint = sc.doc.EarthAnchorPoint
